communications.subject: New Message :: R000108-121523
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: FOIL Records Request of July 05, 2023, Reference # R000108-121523 
Dear Akash Mehta, 
CUNY University Central Office received a FOIL request from you on July 05, 2023. You requested: Multiple Request Types Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records: 
All emails and text messages between Jennifer Raab and Hector Batista, sent between 1/1/2022 and the date at which this request is processed. 
The College has determined that portions of your request can be denied based on the following: Portions of the emails and text messages, if disclosed, would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.  As a result, portions of the emails and text messages responsive to your request are exempted from disclosure under Public Officers Law section 87(2)(b).  Further, portions of the emails and text messages are exempt as inter-agency and/or intra-agency communications pursuant to POL section 87(2)(g) and are therefore redacted and/or withheld. 
Accordingly, your request for records is granted in part and denied in part, and the requested records are available in the records center for your review. Certain portions have been redacted, and/or certain records have not been provided to you based on the explanation above. 
If you disagree with any ruling made in connection with this request, you can appeal to the CUNY’S FOIL Appeals Officer by filling your appeal through the CUNY FOIL portal or by following the instructions listed on CUNY’s FOIL website. 
Sincerely, 
Records Access Officer 
CUNY University Central Office To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the FOIL Records Access Center. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1Hf-2Bciuipwba-2BZOEFHr-2B2ayGn8c4XJ7OVyTFcwhLUrBYi9ak5DH9RWUyOPwKKLdPRQg-3D-3DHU36_ERODacIaBFQ-2BsBuhchOFpaLavAnm7D-2FirmfJhJ1G6A5K4ZViOb7-2BbcqaL8ucH3jjtUSXjg-2Fe94Ps3GJQqpOcRA6eZNeaq78RtGuxcT-2Bvhp6IX8HM6pNutADLkFHBls4CNLIQRwb2-2FPpaChoCmiq7aYrbEkad7FDbq-2F8yrlw0XauSP59XTaO3-2BUCmMzJBp7bZQUznXst9jAfGHpuv0wLJzWujbv5OCxiAaeWVCqang98Fc-2FftvLYsbyW6PDAMpA1Ow2fPFf8uwCG8BxleHw734T-2FB2z-2FLSqzJRVEYcvvpsvQV4XMBik1J0DfQ-2BK9JnWVpSPDQmpljK8O1FzkDy-2F5V5a5Mu-2FNkUs9k2AkV9LUARpAwMHMTW9Uf76KK20aLgq5X)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Kurt Cobain Suicide Investigation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide any and all documents, reports, photos, and video recordings related to the suicide of Kurt Cobain that occurred in his Seattle, Washington residence on April 5, 1994.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

{ Isabella Masella and Ryan Bronte }

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Please provide any and all documents, reports, photos, and video recordings
    related to the suicide of Kurt Cobain that occurred in his Seattle,
    Washington residence on April 5, 1994.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    { Isabella Masella and Ryan Bronte }
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fkurt-cobain-suicide-investigation-155164%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2LqwxtYGuqfh0KS8wwkJeQc%3A1r8AsM%3AKa-3xvNITBgBqFElkh3e78YuxATF4A5MLUL9lPBA2tI

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 1991 Pan-American Games in Cuba
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records produced between Jan. 1, 1991 and Dec. 31, 1991, pertaining to CIA review, analysis, and/or recommendations regarding Cuban preparations for, American athletic preparations for, and press coverage of the Pan-American Games held in Cuba that year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Wolfe

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Terris Greene my regulatory agent with SLED stated I need to request all police reports that were turned over to SLED for discipanary records. I was informed there are approximately 4 to include my arrest. Included in my request is the final report submitted by SLED and filed with the police department where these complaints originated. I need all records for my relicensing PI business license in an alternate state. I am moving out of South Carolina in several months and will need to include all records pertaining to events reported annoymously and by Casey O'hearn.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sara My Capelli and Inquiry Agency, LLC  SLED BUSINESS LICENSE# D0003698

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Sara.

I am not aware of any reports submitted to SLED for disciplinary records however the attached four incident reports are the reports we have in our system that include your name.

Please advise if you have any questions.

Thank you,

Tracy Waldron
Executive Assistant to the Chief of Police
Isle of Palms Police Department
PO Box 508 / 30 J C Long Boulevard
Isle of Palms, South Carolina 29451
twaldron@iop.net<mailto:twaldron@iop.net>

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Lettes from Jail Standards Commission informing Sheriff McNamara of Complaint filed by Bernadette Feazell, ALL Letters from jail standards commission to MCSO and or Sheriff McNamara informing him of non compliance status on jail list. All Appeals filed by McLennan County to recent non compliance. All interoffice memos, reprimands, or correspondence between Sheriff McNamara, Cody Blossman, Major Pam Whitlock and others concerning recent failure to take prisoner to dialysis and subsequent complaint and activities surrounding the Complaint to Jail Standards and results. THIS will probably go to the AG's office once again and if they charge you people, well, it's because they don't want this known and the subsequent coverups. JAIL NON COMPLIANCE is not gossip by the way considering the severity of kidney disease AND the known lack of supervision at the jail.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: C. Boyden Gray
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to Clayland Boyden Gray. Mr. Gray was a lawyer and diplomat who served as White House Counsel from 1989 to 1993 and as U.S. Ambassador to the European Union from 2006 to 2007. He was born on 6 February 1943 in Winston-Salem, NC, USA. He died on 21 May 2023.

PROOF OF DEATH
Obituaries for Mr. Gray appeared in numerous national media, including the New York Times, https://www.nytimes.com/2023/05/21/obituaries/c-boyden-gray-dead.html and the Washington Post, https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2023/05/21/c-boyden-gray-white-house-counsel-president-ghw-bush-dies-80/.

CROSS-REFERENCE SEARCH

Please conduct a cross-reference search of your files on the following people and organizations to see if they contain additional records related to Mr. Gray:

(1) President George Herbert Walker Bush, to whom the subject served as White House Counsel
(2) Chief Justice Earl Warren, to whom the subject was a law clerk
(3) The Atlantic Counsel, on whose board the subject served
(4) The European Institute, on whose board the subject served
(5) FreedomWorks, on whose board the subject served
(6) The Federalist Society, of which the subject was a member

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER

I respectfully request that all fees related to this request be waived.

Public Interest Factors:

1. The subject of the request must concern identifiable operations or activities of the Federal Government. My request satisfies this factor because it seeks records created or maintained by the FBI.

2. The records must be likely to contribute to the understanding of the subject of the request. My request satisfies this factor because Mr. Gray has recently died, so the Bureau may now be able to release records that were not previously available via the FOIA/PA.

3. The disclosure must contribute to the understanding of the public—meaning a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject—as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. My request satisfies this factor because Mr. Gray was a public figure. He served as White House Counsel to George H. W. Bush and was the U.S. Ambassador to the European Union. News obituaries for Mr. Gray appeared in the New York Times, the Washington Post, and other national media. Thus, a broad audience of persons will likely be interested in the records I seek. I will also make any records available online for free via muckrock.com, a FOIA-and-journalism site that lets people share the results of their FOIA requests and encourages journalism around them.

4. The public's understanding must be enhanced by the disclosure to a significant extent. My request likely satisfies this factor because Mr. Gray has recently died—meaning that the Bureau can now release responsive records that it could not have released until now. Given Mr. Gray's government service as a high-level advisor and employee in the executive and judicial branches, the public's understanding of Mr. Gray, his work, and the work of the government will likely be enhanced significantly.

Commercial Interest Factors

1. The existence and magnitude of a commercial interest: I have no commercial interest whatsoever in these records; I am just an inquisitive citizen. Thus, this factor cuts in favor of a fee waiver.

2. The primary interest in disclosure, i.e., whether disclosure is primarily in the commercial interest of the requester: I have zero commercial interest in disclosure, therefore the public interest outweighs my (nonexistent) private interest.

Conclusion:

On balance, all of the Bureau's regulatory factors tilt decisively in favor of granting me a fee waiver. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you anticipate that those fees will exceed $25.

Thank you for your timely attention to this request.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1593177-000
communications.communication:
Dear OIP:

I hearby appeal the Bureau's denial of my request for a fee waiver for my FOIPA Request No. 1593177-000 .

1. The Bureau states that my request failed to meet at least one of the four public interest factors, but it does not say which factor or factors I failed to satisfy or why. This alone is reason enough to reverse the Bureau's decision, because it makes it impossible for the requestor to meaningfully respond to the denial—rendering the denial arbitrary and capricious, an abuse of discretion, and a denial of due process.

2. My request meets the legal standard for a fee waiver. The subject of the request was a public figure, with news obituaries of his death appearing in major newspapers, including the New York Times and the Washington Post. Responsive records will be of great interest to historians, political scientists, scholars, the legal academy, and many others. I am making this request via MuckRock.com, which will automatically make all responsive records available to the general public for free. There is simply no reason to deny this fee waiver.

3. I incorporate by reference the additional arguments I made in my initial request for a fee waiver.

Thank you for your consideration of this appeal.

Most sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

MuckRock Staff

title: Emails between Jennifer Raab and Félix Rodríguez (CUNY — Hunter College)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Emails between Jennifer Raab and Félix Rodríguez (CUNY — Hunter College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All emails and text messages between Jennifer Raab and Félix Rodríguez, sent between 1/1/2022 and the date at which this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Akash Mehta

title: Open Records Request: Open Records Logs

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Open Records Logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Complete Open Records Request logs for the following years:

-2021
-2022

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Re: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Open Records Logs
communications.communication:
Your request has been received and has been assigned reference number 2326671. Please retain this number for future reference.

Requests are reviewed in the order in which they are received.

Please be patient as the Milwaukee Police Department Open Records Section receives a high volume of requests which creates a backlog that can significantly delay our response.



Thank you,

Sgt. Jason Kotarak

Open Records Section

Milwaukee Police Department

communications.subject: Re: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Open Records Request: Open Records Logs
communications.communication:
Please see attached XL files of the data you have requested (ORS ref# 2326671).


​Data can could only be obtained from 10-01-2021 to the present since 10/01/2021 is when the Open Records Section moved to our current database.



The records that the Milwaukee Police Department (MPD) Open Record Section (ORS) believes to be responsive records to your request are attached. With the transmission of these records to you, the records custodian will consider your request closed.



Sergeant Jason Kotarak

Open Records Section

Milwaukee Police Department

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Austin Office Of The Mayor RTO Return to Office Communications 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Email messages and message contents with the keywords "RTO" or "Return to Office" in the email message subject or message body within the last calendar year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brandon Galbraith

communications.subject: Public Information Act Request :: C204891-120423
communications.communication:
Dear Brandon Galbraith: 
Thank you for contacting the City of Austin. Your request was received in this office on 12/4/2023 and given the reference number C204891-120423 for tracking purposes. Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City departments to locate the information you seek. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Email messages and message contents with the keywords "RTO" or "Return to Office" in the email message subject or message body within the last calendar year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brandon Galbraith

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Faustin-mayors-office-15658%252Faustin-office-of-the-mayor-rto-return-to-office-communications-2023-155496%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AABIQo5nfIAanwXe1DlvFIut6RI%3A1rAMLc%3A7-opP_SjnTtJDv7usWMNqCLwuOH-_tWG7iJ6UG4OjEY 
Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, you will receive communication from the City of Austin within 10 business days informing you of one or more of the following: 
• The date the information will be available or a copy of the records sought 
• A cost estimate/invoice 
• A letter advising there is no responsive information for your request or that some/all the responsive information may or must be withheld by the City of Austin in accordance with the law 
• The need for clarification from you. 
Please note your request must ask for records that already exist. The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, perform legal research, or answer questions. 
You can monitor the status of your request using the "My Request Center" menu option at the Austin Public Records Center. 
You will receive an email once your request is complete.

communications.subject: [Austin Public Records Center] :: C204891-120423
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
Re: Public Information Request of December 04, 2023, Reference # C204891-120423 Dear Brandon Galbraith, The City of Austin received a Public Information request from you on December 04, 2023 The City of Austin has responsive information for your request.  Please log in to the Open Records Center at the following link to download the responsive records. City of Austin - Mayor, Council, City Manager, or Assistant City Manager - C204891-120423 Please be advised you have 30 days to access this information. Once that time has passed, you MUST RESUBMIT YOUR REQUEST as the records are no longer available. Furthermore, due to security reasons you have 3 attempts to download the documents before the system will lock the information. Your browser pop-up blockers must be TURNED OFF to successfully access the information. Please make sure these are turned off before attempting to download. A request for copies of records pertaining to the following: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Email messages and message contents with the keywords "RTO" or "Return to Office" in the email message subject or message body within the last calendar year. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Brandon Galbraith 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Faustin-mayors-office-15658%252Faustin-office-of-the-mayor-rto-return-to-office-communications-2023-155496%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AABIQo5nfIAanwXe1DlvFIut6RI%3A1rAMLc%3A7-opP_SjnTtJDv7usWMNqCLwuOH-_tWG7iJ6UG4OjEY” Thank you for contacting the City of Austin. PIR Team City of Austin— Law Department (512) 974-2197 The City of Austin has reviewed your request and has determined that certain portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure under Public Information Act (PIA) and have been redacted for the following reasons: The following notice is required by section 552.137 of the Government Code: The information you requested contains an e-mail address of a member of the public that is provided for the purpose of communicating electronically with a governmental body. As allowed by section 552.137 of the Texas Government Code, this information is confidential and not subject to disclosure under this chapter. Our office is prohibited by law from releasing this information to you, and therefore we have removed this information from the enclosed information we are providing to you. Normally, we must request a ruling from the Texas Attorney General before we can withhold any of the information you requested. However, section 552.137 allows us to withhold this specific information without requesting a ruling from the attorney general. You have the right to appeal our decision to withhold this information from you. Instructions for appeal are included with this letter. If you do not want to appeal, you do not need to do anything else. Please note that we are only withholding the specific categories of information that are confidential under section 552.137. We will process the rest of your request for information in accordance with the terms of the Public Information Act.
